456 PINE ST, ANYTOWN, CA 91234
9835647821

AGENT AUTHORIZED SIGNATURE

ai_analysis.summary: Written amount contains spelling errors in the raw OCR text (“FOUN” instead of “FOUR”, “FISTY” instead of “FIFTY”), indicating document tampering.
reasoning: Manual raw‐text review found misspellings on the amount line (“FOUN HUNDRED FISTY AND 00//100 DOLLARS”), a strong tampering indicator.
Training data shows 45% of fraud cases involve amount mismatches or alterations.
ML ensemble score is low, but spelling‐error detection takes priority over model outputs per policy.
No other fraud indicators (issuer valid, serial format valid, signature present).
actionable_recommendations: Contact MoneyGram to verify the authenticity and correct printed amount.
Request the purchaser to obtain a new money order with properly spelled written amount.
Inspect original document under magnification to check for other signs of forgery.

reasons: Raw OCR text shows “FOUN HUNDRED FISTY” vs. expected “FOUR HUNDRED FIFTY,” signaling manual or counterfeit alteration.
Training patterns indicate high fraud correlation (45%) when numeric and written amounts do not align.

ai_analysis.training_insights: The training set indicates that amount mismatches are among the most reliable fraud predictors; this case aligns directly with those patterns despite a low ML score.
ai_analysis.historical_comparison: No exact past cases, but consistent with known amount‐alteration frauds documented in the dataset.
